newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU invites Museveni, Moi for Zaire talks.
newsitem.headline: EU invites Museveni, Moi for Zaire talks.

text.p: The European Commission has invited the leaders of Uganda and Kenya to Brussels for talks on the war in eastern Zaire.
"We have sent out invitations and we hope that they can come in the next few weeks," a spokesman for the Commission, the EU's executive.
The spokesman said Ugandan president Yoweri Museveni and Kenyan President Daniel Arap Moi had been invited separately.
The two do not see eye-to-eye on the situation in the Great Lakes region where Zairean rebels battling government forces have exacerbated the plight of tens of thousands of Rwandan Hutu refugees.
Uganda has been accused by Zaire of sending troops to fight alongside the rebels, while Kenya has been used as a base by many of the leaders of the former Rwandan army.
The spokesman said former Tanzanian president Julius Nyerere had also been invited to Brussels. Nyerere has been a key figure in trying to negotiate an end to the conflict.
